// *Time Unit* seconds
// // IMPORTANT: The data shown below are results of "hand-made" tests, with functions I wrote. The tests are not completely accurate, since I have not tried out all the possibilities for input data. For ODE solving I have used 3 familiar first order equations, with exponentials, powers and so on (It does not make a relevant difference). I have also considered different time intervals and initial values. Time evaluation was repeated for at least 10 times for each point evaluation before increasing the number of steps. However, the results are sufficiently accurate.

RKODE 

// Array elements represent the number of steps used in each test to discretize time: if 500 and T = 50, 
then dt = (T-t0)/N = 50/500 = 0.1

[500, 600, 700, 800, 900, 1000, 1100, 1200, 1300, 1400, 1500, 1600, 1700, 1800, 1900, 2000, 2100, 2200, 
2300, 2400, 2500, 2600, 2700, 2800, 2900, 3000, 3100, 3200, 3300, 3400, 3500, 3600, 3700, 3800, 3900, 
4000, 4100, 4200, 4300, 4400, 4500, 4600, 4700, 4800, 4900, 5000]

{ Equation: dx/dt = 3*(2**t) + t**2 +4*x
  Initial Values: x0 = 3; t0 = 0;
  Time interval of evaluation: [0,50]
}
